metadata.title: CVE-2019-5419 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
There is a possible denial of service vulnerability in Action View (Rails)<5.2.2.1, <5.1.6.2, <5.0.7.2, <4.2.11.1 where specially crafted acceptheaders can cause action view to consume 100% cpu and make the serverunresponsive.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5419` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

rails - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-actioncable - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-actionmailbox - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-actionmailer - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-actionpack - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-actiontext - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-actionview - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-activejob - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-activemodel - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-activerecord - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-activestorage - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-activesupport - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-rails - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ruby-railties - 2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rails package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:5.2.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
